ADA-S009-DPP4.title: DPP-4 inhibitors: efficacy and CV neutrality
ADA-S009-DPP4.summary: Modest glycemic efficacy; generally CV-neutral. Avoid saxagliptin in HF.

ADA-S009-SU.title: Sulfonylureas and hypoglycemia
ADA-S009-SU.summary: High glycemic efficacy but increased hypoglycemia and weight gain; caution in older adults and CKD.

ADA-S009-AGI.title: α-Glucosidase inhibitors
ADA-S009-AGI.summary: Postprandial effect; modest A1c reduction; GI side effects common.

ADA-S009-colesevelam.title: Colesevelam
ADA-S009-colesevelam.summary: Modest A1c reduction; constipation common; can raise triglycerides.

ADA-S009-bromocriptine.title: Bromocriptine-QR
ADA-S009-bromocriptine.summary: Modest glycemic efficacy; orthostasis and nausea may limit use.

ADA-S009-pramlintide.title: Pramlintide
ADA-S009-pramlintide.summary: Adjunct to insulin; nausea common; reduce insulin to avoid hypoglycemia.

ADA-S009-insulin.title: Insulin class notes
ADA-S009-insulin.summary: High efficacy but increased hypoglycemia and weight gain; analogs reduce nocturnal hypoglycemia vs NPH.

ADA-S016-insulin.title: Inpatient insulin approach
ADA-S016-insulin.summary: Prefer basal ± prandial insulin inpatient; premixed is less flexible and associated with more hypoglycemia.
ADA-S016-insulin.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)

ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.title: GLP-1 RAs & anesthesia
ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.summary: Peri-anesthesia caution due to GI effects and delayed gastric emptying; individualize plans.
ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)
